programme.title: Sky Sports News
programme.desc: Round-up of the sports news, with live analysis and comment, plus extended interviews with the headline-makers.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye Bafana
programme.desc: James Gregory, a prison guard in apartheid-era South Africa and lifelong believer in his society's racist ideology, is assigned to Robben Island prison to watch over its most famous inmate - Nelson Mandela. Over the years an unusual relationship develops between the two, leading Gregory to question his beliefs. Fact-based drama, starring Joseph Fiennes, Dennis Haysbert, Diane Kruger and Shiloh Henderson.(n)

programme.title: The Last Rifleman
programme.desc: Artie Crawford is a Second World War veteran who has just lost his wife. On the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings in Normandy, Artie decides to secretly escape his Northern Ireland care home, and embarks on a journey to France to pay his final respects to his best friend. Drama, starring Pierce Brosnan and Jurgen Prochnow.(n)

programme.title: The Colour Room
programme.desc: Period drama telling the story of Clarice Cliff, who broke the glass ceiling and helped revolutionise the workplace in the 20th century. Clarice is a vivacious young factory worker in the industrial British midlands of the 1920s. Bursting with ideas for colours and shapes, she takes more and more dangerous risks, but manages to stay one step ahead of the workhouse and impress eccentric factory owner Colley Shorter with her talent and innovation. Starring Phoebe Dynevor, Matthew Goode and David Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's biopic of the technology entrepreneur, exploring his life through three pivotal moments over the course of 14 years. Jobs is passionately driven to revolutionise computing technology, but his dreams come at a price, with a devastating impact on both is relationship with his family and his own health. Starring Michael Fassbender, Kate Winslet and Seth Rogen.(n)

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: A fresh-faced Marine's boot-camp training turns into a real tour of duty when he is sent to fight in the Gulf War in 1991. However, the desert action is not what the new recruit expected - the willing soldiers are forced to wait for hours in searing heat, while their day is punctuated by moments of terror. Drama, based on the autobiography by veteran Anthony Swofford, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Jamie Foxx, Peter Sarsgaard and Chris Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Dance First
programme.desc: In 1969 Stockholm, Samuel Beckett is due to receive the Nobel Prize for Literature at a ceremony attended by his wife Suzanne and dignitaries. As he ascends the stage to accept the honour, Beckett sparks a conversation with himself about events and people that have led him to this point. Drama, starring Gabriel Byrne and Aidan Gillen.(n)

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip-hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: American fashion model-turned-war photographer Lee Miller is determined to document the truth of the Nazi regime, and in spite of the odds stacked against female correspondents, she captures some of the most important images of the Second World War. Fact-based drama, starring Kate Winslet, Andy Samberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Marion Cotillard.(n)

programme.title: Steve Jobs

programme.title: What Dreams May Come
programme.desc: The spirit of a man killed in a car crash uses his vivid imagination to create a breath-taking world - but he is unable to fully enjoy his heavenly home without his wife beside him. However, when grief drives her to suicide, she ends up in an altogether more hellish afterlife, prompting her husband to embark on a perilous mission to rescue her from the dark side. Fantasy, starring Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding Jr, Annabella Sciorra and Max von Sydow.(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Biblical drama telling the story of Jesus Christ at the age of seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth and the youngster begins to discover the true extent of his gifts. Adam Greaves-Neal stars, with Sara Lazzaro, Christian McKay and Sean Bean.(n)

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.desc: A sophisticated woman returns to her Southern home town and discovers her options are limited yet discrimination is plentiful. With the help of a Congressional ally, she inspires historic legislation that allows opportunities and protections never before afforded to women. Historical romance, starring Kelsey Grammer, Anna Friel and Sean Astin.(n)

programme.desc: A single mother desperate for work pleads her way into a routine administrative job at a law firm. Realising something is amiss, she begins her own investigation. Fact-based drama, with Julia Roberts in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Albert Finney and Aaron Eckhart.(n)

programme.desc: Concerned about his girlfriend's pregnancy, Ralphie's life spirals when he meets a mysterious family. Writer/director John Trengove's thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Adrien Brody and Odessa Young.

programme.desc: An insurance salesman, hoping to prove his survivalist skills to his family, irresponsibly goes hunting alone. But he isn't prepared for what lies ahead. Writer/director Robert Machoian's drama, starring Clayne Crawford and Jordana Brewster.

programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the town's Lyric Cinema. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce.

programme.title: A Sacrifice
programme.desc: US social psychologist Ben Monroe investigates a local cult connected to an unnerving event, while his daughter becomes mixed up with an enigmatic local boy. Co-writer/director Jordan Scott's drama, starring Eric Bana, Sylvia Hoeks and Sadie Sink (Stranger Things).

programme.title: The United States Vs. Billie Holiday
programme.desc: The acclaimed singer is targeted by the Federal Department of Narcotics with an undercover sting operation led by Federal Agent Jimmy Fletcher, with who she had a tumultuous affair. Director Lee Daniels' biopic based on the novel by Johann Hari, starring Andra Day, Trevante Rhodes and Natasha Lyonne.

programme.title: Jesus Revolution
programme.desc: During the 1970s, a commune of teenage hippies in Southern California paves the way for a national spiritual awakening. Drama based on a true story, starring Joel Courtney, Jonathan Roumie and Kelsey Grammer.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: Cicada
programme.desc: As they continue to recover from separate traumatic events, two young men gradually start to fall for each other. Drama, starring Matthew Fifer and Sheldon D Brown.

programme.title: Mass
programme.desc: Years after an unspeakable tragedy tore their lives apart, two sets of grieving parents agree to talk privately about what happened, in an attempt to move forward. First-time director Fran Kranz' drama, starring Jason Isaacs, Martha Plimpton, Reed Birney and Ann Dowd.

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: Fleeing from his ex-employer, John, a reluctant assassin, seeks refuge in an isolated village, where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Drama based on the Jo Nesbo novel, starring Alessandro Borghi, Jessica Brown Findlay, Peter Mullan and Charles Dance.

programme.title: Six Minutes to Midnight
programme.desc: In the summer of 1939, influential families in Nazi Germany send their daughters to a finishing school in an English seaside town to learn the language and be ambassadors for Hitler. A teacher sees what is coming and tries to raise the alarm, but the authorities believe he is the problem. Thriller, starring Judi Dench, James D'Arcy, Jim Broadbent and Eddie Izzard.

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.

programme.title: Minyan
programme.desc: New York City during the 1980s, and a young gay Russian immigrant looks to escape the constraints of his community and find a world teeming with possibilities. Drama, starring Samuel H Levine and Ron Rifkin.

programme.title: L'immensità
programme.desc: In 1970s Rome, a mother contends with her loveless and abusive marriage while caring for her children, one of who is experiencing gender dysphoria and wishes to identify as a boy. Family drama, starring Penélope Cruz, Vincenzo Amato and Luana Giuliani. In Italian.

programme.title: You Can Live Forever
programme.desc: After moving into a Jehovah's Witness community, lesbian teenager Jamie begins a life-changing love affair with the daughter of a prominent Witness Elder. Drama, starring Anwen O'Driscoll and June Laporte.(n)

programme.title: North Hollywood
programme.desc: A youngster must decide between choosing the future his father wants and following his dream of becoming a pro skateboarder. Confronted with the uncertainty of his future - and how it might impact his friends and family - he takes steps to build relationships with professional skaters in an effort to forge his own path. Comedy drama, starring Ryder McLaughlin, Vince Vaughn and Miranda Cosgrove.(n)

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: Allison is a young woman whose world falls apart when she survives an unimaginable tragedy. While in recovery for an opioid addiction and unresolved grief, she forms an unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law, Daniel, that gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together. Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: General Leslie Groves Jr spearheads the Manhattan Project to research and develop a devastating weapon capable of ending the Second World War. J Robert Oppenheimer and his colleagues subsequently risk destroying humanity to create an atomic bomb. Christopher Nolan's Bafta and Oscar-winning biopic, starring Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Emily Blunt.(n)

programme.title: Calvary
programme.desc: A priest in a rural Irish village receives a confession from a man who vows to kill him in one week as punishment for the Catholic Church's history of child abuse. The cleric spends his last seven days trying to put his community's affairs in order, but finds himself surrounded by people who harbour resentments of their own against the Church. Drama, starring Brendan Gleeson, Chris O'Dowd, Kelly Reilly, Aidan Gillen and Dylan Moran.(n)

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: An ex-convict returns to his home town in north-west China, where he joins a patrol clearing the streets of dogs ahead of the 2008 Olympics. Before long, he bonds with one of the strays and the two lonely souls embark on a new journey together. Drama, starring Eddie Peng. In Mandarin.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Women Oscar Winners
programme.desc: Highlighting female Oscar winners across the categories, from iconic leading ladies to women trailblazing behind the scenes.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.(n)

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Estranged childhood friends Heather and Carla reunite for a cup of tea after not having spoken in many years. At their meeting, Heather presents an unexpected proposition that will change their lives forever. Director Guillem Morales' thriller, starring Naomie Harris and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventure, starring Zachary Levi, Lil Rel Howery, Zooey Deschanel and Benjamin Bottani.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.

programme.title: Fight or Flight
programme.desc: A mercenary is assigned a target on a flight, but when rival assassins board the plane, the hunter and the hunted are forced to team up. Action thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Katee Sackhoff and Julian Kostov.

programme.title: Blood For Dust
programme.desc: A travelling salesman drowning under the weight of providing for his family finds himself on a dangerous path after a chance encounter with a colleague. Action thriller, starring Scoot McNairy, Kit Harington, Josh Lucas and Ethan Suplee.

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Estranged childhood friends Heather and Carla reunite for a cup of tea after not having spoken in many years. At their meeting, Heather presents an unexpected proposition that will change their lives forever. Director Guillem Morales' thriller, starring Naomie Harris and Natalie Dormer.

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.

programme.title: MaXXXine
programme.desc: In 1980s Hollywood, adult film star and aspiring actress Maxine Minx finally gets her big break. But as a mysterious killer stalks the starlets of Tinseltown, a trail of blood threatens to reveal her sinister past. The third instalment of director Ti West's acclaimed X film series, starring Mia Goth, Lily Collins, Giancarlo Esposito and Kevin Bacon.

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga - Chapter 1
programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Meanwhile, a seasoned cowboy goes on the run with a prostitute and a young lad after killing a fellow gunman. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.

programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: Afraid

Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: An ex-convict returns to his home town in north-west China, where he joins a patrol clearing the streets of dogs ahead of the 2008 Olympics. Before long, he bonds with one of the strays and the two lonely souls embark on a new journey together. Drama, starring Eddie Peng. In Mandarin.

programme.title: Anatomy Of A Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired lawyer James Stewart takes on the dark case of an army lieutenant accused of murder. Gripping courtroom drama with Lee Remick.

programme.title: The Day Of The Jackal
programme.desc: When meticulous hitman Edward Fox is hired to kill the French president, detective Michael Lonsdale faces a race against time to track him down. Violent scenes.

programme.title: IT
programme.desc: Hit adaptation of the Stephen King novel about a ragtag bunch of bullied outsiders battling evil, sewer-dwelling clown Pennywise. Jaeden Lieberher stars.

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Val Kilmer is ace thief and master of disguise Simon Templar, hired to steal an energy formula from inventor Elisabeth Shue. Action adventure. Strong language/violence.

programme.title: Fast Times At Ridgemont High
programme.desc: High schoolers Sean Penn and Jennifer Jason Leigh discover the joys of sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll. Classic 80s comedy with a script by Cameron Crowe. Sex/mature themes.

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.desc: Leo DiCaprio stars as the teen conman who led the FBI on a paper chase, with Tom Hanks as the agent on his trail. Real-life caper from Steven Spielberg. Strong language.

programme.title: Fear And Loathing In Las Vegas
programme.desc: Writer Johnny Depp and lawyer Benicio Del Toro drive to Las Vegas, fuelled by a cocktail of psychedelic drugs. Road movie based on Hunter S Thompson's novel. Mature themes.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. He is transformed into the superhero Blue Beetle, who is protected by a suit of armour. However, powerful businesswoman Victoria Kord will stop at nothing to acquire the Scarab. Fantasy adventure based on the DC Comics creation, starring Xolo MaridueÃ±a and Bruna Marquezine.

programme.title: Insidious: The Red Door
programme.desc: Ten years have passed since Josh Lambert and son Dalton escaped from The Further and reunited with Renai. Dalton is preparing to leave home for an Ivy League university, until demons from the past resurface with a vengeance and threaten to destroy Dalton and everyone around him. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson and Ty Simpkins.

programme.title: The American Society of Magical Negroes
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Justice Smith and David Alan Grier. Genial artist Aren, who is African-American, is struggling to make sense of his place in the world until he's invited to join a secret society dedicated to enhancing the lives of white people. However, Aren's debut mission tests his loyalty when he and his first assignment fall for the same person.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Musical adaptation of Alice Walker's novel, starring Fantasia Barrino and Taraji P Henson. In early 20th-century Georgia, young Celie is forced to marry the tyrannical farmer "Mister". For years, Celie's life is bleak and difficult, but when Mister's mistress, the spirited jazz singer Shug Avery, comes to stay, Celie begins to believe in herself.

programme.title: One More Shot
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL squad leader escorts a suspected terrorist from a black site when they come under fire from a group of mercenaries. Director James Nunn's thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Alexis Knapp and Tom Berenger.

programme.title: Please Don't Destroy: The Treasure of Foggy Mountain
programme.desc: Directionless twenty something Ben Patterson lives with pals John and Martin. All three work at the Trout Plus outdoor goods emporium run by Ben's overbearing father, Farley. A random social media post intimates that an old compass, which Ben, John and Martin found as children, could be the missing link to discovering a bust of Marie Antoinette worth an estimated 100million US dollars. Ben resolve

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaub's comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin.

programme.title: Blue Beetle
programme.desc: An ancient relic of alien biotechnology known as the Scarab chooses college graduate Jaime Reyes as its symbiotic host. Dalton is preparing to leave home for an Ivy League university, until demons from the past resurface with a vengeance and threaten to destroy Dalton and everyone around him. Horror sequel, starring Patrick Wilson and Ty Simpkins.

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure based on the books by Holly Black and Tony DiTerlizzi, starring Freddie Highmore and Sarah Bolger. When twins Jared and Simon Grace and their sister Mallory move into their aunt's dilapidated house in the country, they are drawn into a magical world that reveals the strange history of the property and of their family.

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Barry Allen uses his super speed to change the past, but his attempt to save his family creates a world without superheroes. Comic-book adventure, with Ezra Miller, Sasha Calle, Michael Keaton and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Action horror thriller starring Jason Statham and Li Bingbing. After failing to save the crew of an imperilled submarine, deep sea rescue diver Jonas Taylor is unfairly branded a drunk and a coward. Five years later, he spies an opportunity to prove everybody wrong when he is approached to aid a team of researchers in their fight against a giant prehistoric shark.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Underwater rescue expert Jonas Taylor leads a research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. However, a greedy mining operation threatens the team's safety and unleashes a school of voracious 75ft-long megalodon sharks. Director Ben Wheatley's comedy thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham and Cliff Curtis.

programme.title: Five Nights at Freddy's
programme.desc: Mike Schmidt accepts a position as night-time security guard at the abandoned pizzeria, where families used to flock in their droves in the 1980s. He is desperate to earn money to keep a roof over the head of his younger sister Abby, but is soon locked in a fight for survival. Horror thriller based on a series of video games, starring Josh Hutcherson and Piper Rubio.

programme.title: American Star
programme.desc: Out to kill a man he has never met, Wilson, a seasoned assassin completing his final assignment in Fuerteventura, is drawn to a ghostly shipwreck. Thriller, starring Ian McShane, Nora Arnezeder and Fanny Ardant.

programme.desc: Franklin, a blogger, scuppers an attack against tech guru Anton Burrell, and finds a ring that the pioneering genius dropped. programme.desc: Roman and Kendall do a "routine health check" of a new media brand to help Vaulter to determine the future of the company; Tom tasks Greg with sniffing out waste at ATN; Connor and Willa host a soiree to mark their return to New York.

programme.title: Succession
programme.desc: Logan informs his management team of his plan to make another attempt to acquire a rival media company; Greg worries his meeting with a Logan biographer puts his standing with the family at risk; Connor's presidential announcement irritates Logan.

programme.desc: Roman begins a six-week management training program; Connor and Willa attend the funeral of a family friend with a complicated past; Logan and Kendall arrange a covert meeting with PGM CEO Rhea Jarrell; controversy surrounds a star anchor.

programme.desc: As Logan looks to finalize a deal to buy the Pierce family's papers and TV stations, a threat to the deal arises from an unexpected quarter; Tom worries about ATN's new slogan after learning some distressing news from Greg.

programme.desc: The entire Roy clan travels to Logan's hometown of Dundee, Scotland, for a celebration of Logan's 50 years in the business; Kendall becomes enamored with Jennifer, an actress in Willa's play; a former employee proves difficult to silence.
